author: Yuliya Fedorinova
title: Uralkali Increases Buyback to $2.26 Billion as China Sells Stake
text:
Uralkali PJSC increased a buyback offer by 71 percent to $2.26 billion after China opted to sell its stake in the Russian potash producer.
Uralkali got bids to repurchase 20.24 percent of its stock after Chengdong Investment Corp. tendered its 12.5 percent holding, the Russian fertilizer company said in a statement Friday. The buyback program covers as much 24 percent compared with 14 percent for $1.32 billion under the earlier plan.
The buyback may lead Uralkali to delist its shares in London and Moscow if its free float, or level of publicly available shares, shrinks beyond a certain point, the company said in August.
Uralkali shares jumped as high as 4.6 percent, the most in a month, and traded up 2.5 percent at 185.85 rubles ($2.83) as of 12:08 p.m. Moscow. The potash producer is paying $3.20 a share or $16 a global depositary receipt.
